data.title: Took someone here for birthday
data.text: Had excellent service.  We had a few drinks and a little bit to eat.  We were there mainly celebrating a birthday.  They took great care of us!

data.title: Not like other hooters.
data.text: Have this Hooters a second chance. My wife and I visit annually and had a less than enjoyable experience last year. This year the place was filthy and smelled of urinal mints throughout the dining area. Our server took 20 minutes to bring our drinks then we watched from the patio as she left to go get dinner at another place across the street while we were left sitting there. Save your money go somewhere else.

data.title: stay open late and always offers good food and sports TV
data.text: it is a great place to head to when you wanna see some sports on TV and grab a beer. The food is also good and it is always open later than most places

data.title: Fun Hooters in and setting Other than Florida!
data.text: Nice upstairs setting with out outdoor balcony seating. Food is equal to other Hooters, lots of TVs and very friendly staff there to serve you! Excellent service, constant checking on the table and very personable service!

data.title: Just ok
data.text: I used to live in Tempe many moons ago and this Hooters was always one of the best. I have since moved around the US and Hooters is one of my favorites. Stopped in recently while in town for business. Service was still great but the place seemed dirty and a little run down from what it used to be. The food was ok but years later this hardly lived up to the way it used to be. Still has good outdoor seating with a view of Sun Devil stadium and Mill Ave.

data.title: Great Wings & Deep Fried Pickles
data.text: Took my wife to Hooters, one of our favourite chains. I had wings, as usual they were great, they had some new flavours. My wife tried a new shrimp salad and said the flavour was good. Our waitress Robin was very friendly. She even gave us some iced tea to go. Also the deep fried pickles were great. And the location was fun as well ( upstairs with a balcony).

data.title: Dirty
data.text: I'm a huge Hooters fan but his place was nasty.  I didn't want to touch anything. I cleaned the salt & pepper shakers before I touched them - they were just caked with yuk.  The bathrooms obviously had not been cleaned in a while.  Our waitress Paige was nice and did give us great service.  The buffalo chicken salad was terrible, they used boneless chicken "pieces" and I think I maybe had 5 dried out pieces on my salad but TONS of red onion slices. hmmm

data.title: Bad service, ok food....
data.text: We waited outside for over 20minutes until I had to go inside and ask if anyone was coming out( we hadn't even had our drinks taken) then there were 2 other people in the restaurant and our food took 30+ to come out. They also got my husbands order wrong. Never going back.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: My wife and a friend went here.  The food was good to great and the beer was cold as I like it.  The only thing I did not like was the hostess at the beginning of this experience.  She was reluctant to sit us where e wanted which was outside and to watch the particular football game.  That request seemed to frustrate her but we did eventually get what we wanted.  Will return

data.title: Great place with great people
data.text: In town for business and of course I had to stop here for a beer.  My server was Ioana, a really lovely person.  They had a beer special which was described to me as soon as i was seated.  I did not have to ask.  Service was fast and friendly.  I would certainly recommend this Hooters.  Great job!

data.title: Great lunch
data.text: We came in early on a Sunday and happened to be the first ones in the door.They were more than happy to seat & serve us.Typical Hooter's food so you can't go wrong if you know what your ordering.Clean establishment

data.title: Don't bother with a menu!
data.text:
So we were starving and didn't know the area and decided its a Hooters. Known commodity right? Well not so much. I've been to other Hooters and never had a problem. 

This vist I checked out the menu and placed my order. Turns out they did not have the beverage I ordered so the waitress decided what I would drink. I ordered food and well once again I was delivered what the waitress decided I would eat. When I complained about it the manager said she would discount it....no discount when the bill arrived. I decided this would be it. I payed and gladly left this establishment.

data.title: Hooters on mill
data.text: We went to be able to watch the NCAA games but the table was sticky whch left us with a dirty feeling overall and the food and service were just average. They need to step it up a notch to get our business again.

data.title: Great Food, Freindly Service
data.text: The Hooters was just across the street from Peoria Sports Complex, it had all types of sports playing on the many tv's, and the food was great, as well as the price! Waitresses were very friendly, and were interested in hearing about our experience in Phoenix!

data.title: Great location for wings. Nice balcony and atmosphere.
data.text: Been eating here for many years when i am in town. Always good food and service. Great location nice atmosphere. Always great Hooters girls to take care of the customers. Can not go wrong here. Always a plesure.

data.title: Great for people watching
data.text: Has a great balcony over looking Mill street.  Perfect place to catch a little March madness and people watch.

data.title: Just like every other HOOTERS!
data.text: Nothing to rave about, but when you want a known commodity, HOOTERS serves its purpose. I would say that the waitresses were above average, if that's why you go to HOOTERS.

data.title: A very good stop before the airport
data.text:
I've been stopping at this restaurant for more than a decade and it has always been fine for me.  Nobody goes to Hooters looking for the finest in delicacies but the beer is cold, the burgers are tasty and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We recently stopped in an told the manager on duty that we only had 30 minutes before we had to run to catch a flight.  Our server was over promptly and helped us get our order in quick.  Even though she was helping us finish lunch in a hurry she wasn't pushing us out of the place either.

The location is really good being pratcically on the ASU campus.  We've come here before football games, during Nascar weekends and I've always received prompt and curteous service. As I said, I've been here before and I know I'll be back!

data.title: The food was good - the service was ok
data.text: The food was good.  Our table was a bit crowded - although it had six seats, it was cramped with six people.  We especially enjoyed the breaded wings.  The beer was cold. The margaritas did not seem to have that much tequila in them - I had two and did not feel a thing.  The service was ok - the waitress forgot a few things that we asked for.

data.title: Great location. If the weather is nice sit on the patio and people watch.
data.text:
Every Hooters is pretty much the same in terms of ambiance and food. I have been here many times and have never been displeased by either. Everyone is always friendly and helpful and there are plenty of TV's and things to watch. 

What sets this Hooters apart is it's location. It is upstairs on the corner of Mill Avenue and 5th Street in the heart of downtown Tempe. If you can sit out on the balcony overlooking the intersection it is a treat. Great weather and a great place to people watch and eat and drink with friends. 

I wold recommend it to anyone in the area.
